pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with Prime Minister of Australia Scott Morrison | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Today, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke with the Prime Minister of Australia, Scott Morrison, to discuss their efforts to fight the COVID-19 pandemic. 

Prime Minister Morrison offered condolences for the tragedy in Nova Scotia.

The two leaders spoke about recent developments related to the COVID-19 pandemic, including measures taken to protect the health and safety of their citizens.  They exchanged perspectives on the status of pandemic response in their respective countries as well as efforts to mitigate the economic impact. 

Prime Minister Trudeau and Prime Minister Morrison agreed that international coordination remained essential and committed to staying in close touch.

COVID-19 is a rapidly evolving global challenge. The Government of Canada is working closely with local, provincial, territorial, and international partners to minimize its health, economic, and social impacts in Canada and around the world.
